p.span: As we end another week of home instruction, I am tremendously grateful for our staff, students, and families as we navigate this difficult journey together. It is amazing to see all of the hard work happening in our classes despite the circumstances. Recently, I participated in a lesson with teachers, students, and paraprofessionals where I was able to see this hard work first hand. Witnessing teachers and students at all grade levels continue to utilize technology to stay connected and engaged is reassuring for the short term as well as the long term. I have confidence that our learning community will continue to thrive under this unique set of circumstances. Technology cannot replace the experience of learning in a physical classroom. However, the new skills and abilities our students are learning districtwide will undoubtedly add value to the evolution of student learning.

At the beginning of this school year, we hosted Priya Parker, acclaimed author ofThe Art of Gathering: How We Meet and Why it Matters, to connect with staff and kick off another year of learning. Her message of intentional collaboration was an opportunity for our educators to ask important questions about how and why we gather. The purpose of this idea of intentional gathering as she describes in her book is that when you gather well, one of the outcomes is you create a sense of belonging. In this time of uncertainty, society finds itself asking similar questions with greater urgency. While how we gather has changed, our desire to create spaces of belonging in our individual, school, and collective community has not.

Understanding the significance of how and why we gather has never been more important. While social distancing is difficult and we deeply miss our students, its important to remember the purpose of being apart. Through our collective efforts, one day we can and will be able to come back together again. Although our schools and non-essential businesses remain closed for an indefinite period of time, there is hope in the acknowledgement that these trying circumstances will not last forever.

While we still have a lot to celebrate and be hopeful for during this difficult time, this does not diminish the severity of this crisis and the impact it has had on communities around the world. However, in order to get through these challenges, it is important that we remain optimistic. In whatever ways we can, we must gather meaningfully and purposefully with the intention of supporting one another. We will continue to work with our building leadership teams and educators to ensure the academic, social, and emotional needs of our students continue to be met. We will always reflect and grow, and we are proud of the foundation we have built prior to this unforeseen circumstance. Your continued support and strength will help us ensure that every student continues to have a positive learning experience during this unique time. We continue to be stronger when we are united.
